headline: WHODUNNIT? GOP clamors for names in Cawthorn “Orgy-gate” accusations
author: Ty Ross
sentences:
Cover-up specialist Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) refused to defend Cawthorn’s alleged sexcapades, telling The Daily Beast that he doesn’t “know anything about what Madison referenced”
Even the perennial front runner for dumbest Congressman, Texas Republican Louis Gohmert called the North Carolina freshman’s remarks “bizarre.”
Cawthorn is facing pressure from all sides now, inside and outside the party.

Senator Richard Burr (R-NC) told Manu Raju of CNN that the Congressman representing a district in Burr’s home state has “been an embarrassment at times.”
By embarrassment, Burr should be referring to the Republican Party, although I think many would argue that, after Trump’s election in 2016, the “embarrassment” ship sailed long ago.

In an interview on the right-wing podcast Warrior Poet Society, Madison Cawthorn (R-NC) dropped an unexpected bombshell — accusations of a sex and drug-filled atmosphere within his political circle, throwing his GOP colleagues under the proverbial, if not literal, bus.

Hear Rep. Steve Womack stood up, said he hardly ever stands to talk, he has to say something about this bc now he is getting Qs about which members partaking in orgies after Cawthorn suggested they are happening in DC along w/ the use of cocaine.

Sponsored Links
So, Madison Cawthorne only hangs out with hard core MAGA people in DC…
The American public deserves to know which members of congress are doing cocaine and having orgies because they are unfit for office.

More from Occupy Democrats: SEX, DRUGS & GOP: Rep. Madison Cawthorn reveals sordid stories of cocaine and “sexual get togethers”
Add your name to call on prosecutors to ARREST DONALD TRUMP for his crimes!
With calls to “name names” from his colleague Rep. Dan Crenshaw (R-TX), Cawthorn’s feet are being held to the transparency fire by other Republicans.

https://t.co/TsmBxJ4g6t
— Meghan McCain (@MeghanMcCain) March 29, 2022
Sponsored Links
Well, if Meghan McCain is asking – it’s a must.
That was for his inflammatory rhetoric, but I imagine the latest scandal surrounding the Congressman will only add fuel to the fire.
Standing up before his party, the Republican demanded answers at the insistence of his constituents back home demanding answers.

Sponsored Links
A caucus meeting of House Republicans had many of Cawthorn’s colleagues speaking up to address the issue.
According to Politico’s Olivia Beavers, even the usually quiet Steve Womack (R-AR) felt compelled to say his peace.
He’s up for re-election in a state that has grown increasingly intolerant and impatient with his representation.
Even former View host, Meghan McCain chimed in, insinuating that those Cawthorn is referring to must be MAGA.
Former classmates, present colleagues — even the Durham Herald-Sun newspaper — publicly criticized Cawthorn.

— Olivia Beavers (@Olivia_Beavers) March 29, 2022
Cawthorn doesn’t have much GOP support at this point.
Now, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) said he will address the issue with Cawthorn.

Advertisement Above
The GOP muck has finally hit the fan for Madison Cawthorn.
Time to put up, or shut up — though I imagine some may come to regret asking.
So far, Congressman Cawthorn has avoided adding any more to his accusations.
Should we all just start guessing the people he’s talking about?
The old term “be careful what you wish for”, comes to mind.
The sexcapade-accusing Representative skipped the caucus.
No people, places, or times have been revealed.
The buzz isn’t likely to die down anytime soon.
As one might expect, they are none too pleased.
This is a rarity for any member of the GOP.
Told Cawthorn not there this am.

Isn’t it?
